SEARCH
Package file_manager.operations

Class FileOperations

java.lang.Object
file_manager.operations.FileOperations
public class FileOperations extends Object
Utility class for performing file operations such as creation, deletion, renaming, reading, writing, copying, and moving files within the File Manager application.

All methods handle user input validation and error reporting, and prompt the user for missing parameters if null is provided.

This class is not intended to be instantiated.

  • Constructor Details

    • FileOperations

      public FileOperations()

  • Method Details

    • newFile

      public static void newFile(String fileNameToCreate)
      Creates a new file with the specified name in the current working directory. If the name is null, prompts the user to enter a file name. Prints a message indicating whether the file was created or if it already exists.
      Parameters:
      fileNameToCreate - the name of the file to create, or null to prompt the user

    • clearFile

      public static void clearFile(String fileNameToClear)
      Removes all contents from the specified file, effectively clearing it. If the file name is null, prompts the user to enter a file name. Prints a message if the file does not exist.
      Parameters:
      fileNameToClear - the name of the file to clear, or null to prompt the user

    • delFile

      public static void delFile(String fileNameToDelete)
      Deletes the specified file from the current working directory. If the file name is null, prompts the user to enter a file name. Prints a message indicating whether the file was deleted or if it does not exist.
      Parameters:
      fileNameToDelete - the name of the file to delete, or null to prompt the user

    • renameFile

      public static void renameFile(String originalFileName, String newFileName)
      Renames an existing file to a new name within the current working directory. If either parameter is null, prompts the user for the missing value(s). Prints a message indicating success or failure.
      Parameters:
      originalFileName - the current name of the file, or null to prompt the user
      newFileName - the new name for the file, or null to prompt the user

    • readFile

      public static String readFile(String fileNameToRead)
      Reads and prints the contents of the specified file to the console. If the file name is null, prompts the user to enter a file name. Returns the file contents as a String.
      Parameters:
      fileNameToRead - the name of the file to read, or null to prompt the user
      Returns:
      the contents of the file as a String (empty if file not found)

    • writeFile

      public static void writeFile(String fileNameToWrite, String textToAppend)
      Appends the specified text to the end of the given file. If the file name or text is null, prompts the user for the missing value(s). Prints a message if the file does not exist.
      Parameters:
      fileNameToWrite - the name of the file to write to, or null to prompt the user
      textToAppend - the text to append, or null to prompt the user

    • copy

      public static String copy(String sourceFileName, String destinationFileName)
      Copies the contents of the source file to a new file. If the target file name is null, generates a unique name based on the source file. Prompts the user for missing parameters if necessary. Prints error messages for invalid paths or existing files.
      Parameters:
      sourceFileName - the name of the source file to copy, or null to prompt the user
      destinationFileName - the desired name for the new file, or null to auto-generate
      Returns:
      the name of the newly created file, or null if the operation failed

    • move

      public static void move(String sourceFileNameToMove, String destinationDirectoryPath)
      Moves the specified file to a new directory. If the source file name or target path is null, prompts the user for the missing value(s). Handles file overwriting by copying and deleting if the target already exists. Prints error messages for missing files or invalid paths.
      Parameters:
      sourceFileNameToMove - the name of the file to move, or null to prompt the user
      destinationDirectoryPath - the destination directory path, or null to prompt the user
